# Pure-text editions of  a single page

```{julia}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| output: false
# Set to point to a local copy of HMT Archive.jl dir;
repo = pwd() |> dirname |> dirname
using HmtArchive.Analysis
cexdata = joinpath(repo, "test", "data", "hmt-2024a.cex") |> read |> String
```

Pure-text editions are organized by physical page of a manuscript, identified by a `Cite2Urn`. 

```{julia}
#| output: false
using CitableObject
pg1 = Cite2Urn("urn:cite2:hmt:msA.v1:300r")
```



```{julia}
#| warning: false
using HmtGutenberg
mdoutput = formatpage(pg1)
```

The default format includes some light formatting in Markdown. 

---

## Rendered example

The following cell formats the markdown for display in environments like Quarto, VS Code and Pluto or Jupyter notebooks:

```{julia}
#| asis: true
using Markdown
mdoutput |> Markdown.parse
```
